sentences.en: A criminal record will prejudice your chances of getting a job.
sentences.cn: 犯罪记录会不利于你就业。

sentences.en: a victim of racial prejudice
sentences.cn: 种族偏见的受害者

sentences.en: He continued to smoke, to the prejudice of his health.
sentences.cn: 他继续吸烟, 这不利于他的健康.

sentences.en: He had a prejudice against them.
sentences.cn: 他对他们有偏见.

sentences.en: He has removed the virus of prejudice.
sentences.cn: 他消除了有害的偏见.

sentences.en: He is free from prejudice to everybody.
sentences.cn: 他对所有的人都不带有任何成见.

sentences.en: He refused to comment, saying he did not wish to prejudice the outcome of the talks.
sentences.cn: 他拒绝发表评论，称不希望影响会谈结果。

sentences.en: He was a victim of racial prejudice.
sentences.cn: 他是种族歧视的受害者。

sentences.en: His voice and manner prejudice his audience against him.
sentences.cn: 他的声音和举止都使听众反感.

sentences.en: I think your upbringing has prejudiced you.
sentences.cn: 我认为你的教养使你抱有偏见。

sentences.en: I'm calling in reference to your series on prejudice.
sentences.cn: 我打电话是要谈谈你写的有关“偏见”的系列文章。

sentences.en: I've spent a lifetime fighting against racism and prejudice.
sentences.cn: 我一辈子都在同种族主义和偏见作斗争。

sentences.en: It takes a long time to overcome these kinds of prejudices.
sentences.cn: 战胜这些偏见需要假以时日。

sentences.en: Prejudice sometimes hampers a person from doing the right thing.
sentences.cn: 有时候,偏见会妨碍人正确行事.

sentences.en: Rowe does a very clever riff on the nature of prejudice.
sentences.cn: 罗就偏见的本质讲了一番很精辟的话。

sentences.en: the iniquity of racial prejudice
sentences.cn: 种族偏见的罪恶

sentences.en: the payment was made &B{without} any &B{prejudice to} her rights.
sentences.cn: 这笔款的支付对她的权利没有任何损害。

sentences.en: The report was held back for fear of prejudicing his trial.
sentences.cn: 因为担心会使他的审判带有偏见，该报告没有公开。

sentences.en: There was concern that reports in the media would prejudice the jury.
sentences.cn: 有人担心媒体的报道会影响陪审团的公正性。

sentences.en: They accused him of having a prejudice against his women employees.
sentences.cn: 他们指责他歧视女雇员.

sentences.en: They have been steeped in prejudice since their childhood.
sentences.cn: 他们从小就充满了偏见.

sentences.en: We accept the outcome of the inquiry, without prejudice to the unsettled question of territorial waters.
sentences.cn: 我们接受了调查结果，并没有使悬而未决的领海问题进一步恶化。

sentences.en: Women still face prejudice in the workplace.
sentences.cn: 女性在职场中仍然面临歧视。

sentences.en: Your bad spelling may prejudice your chances of getting this job.
sentences.cn: 你糟糕的拼写会妨碍你获得这个工作的机会.

words.tran_cn: 怀偏见的；有成见的；偏颇的
不利的；有害的；引起偏见的
损害（prejudice的过去分词）；使抱偏见
偏见,成见;预先形成的概念;事先决定

trans.tran_en: an un-reasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc – used to show disapproval
an un-reasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc – used to show disapproval
to influence someone so that they have an unfair or unreasonable opinion about someone or something
an un-reasonable dislike and distrust of people who are different from you in some way, especially because of their race, sex, religion etc – used to show disapproval

trans.tran_cn: 使有偏见； 对…不利， 损害
trans.tran_en: to influence someone so that they have an unfair or unreasonable opinion about someone or something
